cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles E of Tampico, Mexico and 330 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north-northeast in the west-central Gulf, forecast to turn north and then west toward the Texas coast through early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-upper Texas coast (between Matagorda Bay and Galveston)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward to southwest Louisiana and southward to the Mexican Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (up to 9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34–39 kt) by late Monday–Tuesday; gusts could reach 35–45 mph if the center tracks closer to the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the system strengthens and approaches the upper Texas coast, a surge of 1–3 ft above ground level is possible along the Jefferson County shoreline and Sabine Pass.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow motion and moisture convergence could bring 4–8 inches of rain with isolated higher totals to the Port Arthur area beginning late weekend through Tuesday, creating fresh-water flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf beginning this weekend; possible channel siltation and minor coastal flooding that could hamper port operations.
